intro: Mapania affinis, commonly known as the common mapania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are oval-shaped, green when unripe, and turn orange-red when mature. Mapania affinis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
